sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
What is the clique number of the graph below?

    1---2
     \ / \
      3---4---5
       \ /
        6

Provide the numerical value of the clique number for this graph.
message_2:
The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph (or clique) in the graph. A complete subgraph is a subgraph in which every pair of vertices is connected by an edge.

In the given graph, we can observe the following cliques:

1. {1, 2, 3} - a triangle (3 vertices)
2. {2, 3, 4} - a triangle (3 vertices)
3. {3, 4, 6} - a triangle (3 vertices)
4. {3, 6} - an edge (2 vertices)
5. {4, 5} - an edge (2 vertices)
6. {1, 3} - an edge (2 vertices)
7. {2, 4} - an edge (2 vertices)

The largest clique in this graph has 3 vertices, so the clique number is 3.
